template.p: Hello there!
You just installed the Odoo for Bookstore package. By doing so, we have installed a bunch of necessary apps to run your bookstore efficiently.
Discover the basics of this package and explore all the possibilities Odoo offers to improve your experience.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: If you want to execute a practical guided tour of this module, you should Import demo data and try the Demo - Use Case. (In the next Knowledge Article)

div.a: Do you want to go further?

template.p: You can access every installed App in your Odoo database on your main dashboard.

ul.li: Use the Point of Sale for your sales at the desk. Manage your customer accounts and advantage in the Contacts App.
Use the Sales App to order books for your customers, create quotations for your institutional clients (libraries, schools, etc.), and invoice them on the go using the Invoicing App.
Use the Purchase App to order books from your distributors.
Use the Inventory App to manage your orders receive and deliver your products.
Use the Barcode App to scan your products and create new entries directly from this App to encode new books faster than ever.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Odoo is entirely integrated into an App. Download it to turn your phone into an additional scanner (and much more).

template.p: By uploading this module's demo data, your database has been filled with a few products and 2 sample contacts.
You should be able to execute the following flows to have an overview of various flows you can quickly execute with this package using Odoo.
Of course, this is just an overview of the features included in this package. Feel free to add new apps, delete/modify demo data, and test everything around!

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-warning pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You didn't import demo data? You can still do it. Go to Apps > Industries > Upgrade your Bookstore package and check the related box.

template.p: From the Point of sale, open your register on the main dashboard.
1. Welcome Elise, your favorite customer, she wants to buy the "Da Vinci Code".
2. Elise also wants to buy a 50‚Ç¨ Gift Card for a friend.
3. Elise has a customer account; select her using the "Customer" button.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You can see that Elise has a Loyalty Card. The demo Library applies a 5% discount for every 200‚Ç¨ spent. Manage Promotions, and Loyalty programs under Point of Sale > Products.

template.p: 4. Register Elise's payment. You can now go back to your main dashboard by selecting "Backend" in the top-right burger menu.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: If you look for Elise in your "Contact" database, you can see that the Odoo Smart Buttons at the top of her page can bring you to her customer history, Elise may even see it on her website account if you activate the relevant apps and configurations.

template.p: 1. You welcome now Hanna Liseuse, but she has a very specific need. She's looking for "Media Burn: Ant Farm and the Making of an Image". You don't have this book in stock, let's order it.

2. Once you've found it on your local books database, go to the sales app and create a new product using its ISBN code : 9781941753354. Define the current distributor in your region by going to the "Purchase" tab (use "My Book Distributor" for this case).
3. You can now create a new quotation. Type her name in the "Customer" field to create a new contact.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Use the internal link button, at the right of the field, to view the new contact record created, and don't forget to add an email address for her to receive notifications. Go back to your quotation using the breadcrump.

template.p: 4. Add the product to your quotation by searching for its ISBN. You can directly click on the confirm button to turn your quotation in a Sales Order.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You can make a down payment using the Point of Sales. To do so, just go back to this app and click on the Quotation/Order button to retreive the Sales Order.

template.p: Let's say you now need to create a quotation for "The Great Library" near your shop.
1. Go to the "Sales" App and create a new quotation using the main "New" button on the top left.
2. They want to get an offer for three copies of "Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone," "Hidden Life of Trees," and "Sapiens: Brief History of Humankind."
3. Once your quotation is ready, you can email it or confirm it.
4. Check the smart buttons, a new delivery has been created, but you need to have all products in stock.
5. Go to the Inventory App. A new Replenishment is suggested under Operations > Replenishment.
6. If you select your product and click on "Order", a new Purchase Order is created, you can then email it to your distributor and confirm the order placement.

7. A few days later, you receive your order from the distributor. Go to the Inventory App on you dashboard, you'll see that a new receipt is ready to be processed. Select it and validate your reception.
8. The last product is now in stock, you can go back to your Sales Order and process the delivery by clicking the "Delivery" smart button.
1. We can now go through your weekly replenishment report to ensure a good supply in your shop. To do so, navigate to the Inventory App > Operations > Replenishment.
2. By clicking on the search bar, you can select the "Weekly replenishment" filter. It displays every products sold this week and their remaining quantity.
3. Choose how much of each you want to buy by entering the value in the "To Order" column.
4. Click then on the "Order" button to add it to your purchase orders.

5. Navigate to the Purchase App. You can see that all purchase orders have been created and are ready to be sent to your distributors. Enter your purchase orders and send them to your vendors using the Send by Email button.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: You can also use automated Reordering rules to ensure you will always have your best seller in stock.

template.p: This time, you received a new release from one of your distributors. Prepare your scanner and go to the Barcode App.

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Or easier, download the Odoo App on your mobile phone, connect to your database, and select the Barcode App to transform your phone into an additional scanner!

template.p: 1. Go to the Barcode App, and select "Operations".
2. In "Receipts", create a new reception by clicking the "New" button.
3. Scan your products. If it does not exist in your database, they will be created with the correct picture, title, and price.
4. Enter the cost of each new product so you can easily reorder it afterward.
5. Validate the reception, and this is it! (A purchase order will be automatically created so you can easily reconcile your vendor bills).

div.class: o_editor_banner o_not_editable lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: If you want to sale consignment products, this is standard in Odoo.

template.p: Time to return some unsold products. This works like a reverted purchase order.
1. Go to the Purchase App.
2. Create a new request for quotation, and start adding your products.
3. Set the quantity in negative value to create a reverted purchase.
You can now confirm the purchase, validate the delivery using the smart button, and print your delivery slip.
As monitoring your success is essential, there are some views that might interest you:
1. View results

ul.li: ‚ÄãTrack your sales order in Sales App > Reporting > Sales

template.p: 2. Control your stock

Control the aging of your stock, and easily export aged stock in the inventory valuation report (Inventory > Reporting > Valuation).
